intro: Goniothalamus longistaminus, commonly known as the long-stamen goniothalamus, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, green fruits that mature to a yellowish color, containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
